channel.title: Tim Videos Planet - Developers news - Category: GSOC-2014 / Tag: NEWS
channel.description: News from our best developers, all news aggregated by planet.

item.title: [GSoC] What happenned during this week? (week 5)
item.description:
It was a great month, I learned a lot about Jekyll and Ruby, wrote a lot of new plugins, contributed to planet.rb and my first GitHub pull request. A lot of great work was made thanks to GSoC and TimVideos organization, thank you guys. :) I am really satisfied about my work during this month and can't wait to see results of my work in next 2 months.

During this week I spend a lot of time on integrating planet.timvideos.us with GitHub API to get a lot of information from GitHub repositories and integrating edit interface (prose.io) to work with our getting-started page.

On edit interface I've added prose.io realistic preview to every edit, so you will see your changes with realistic preview, I've also added edit button to every editable part of website to make editing easier.

I've created GitHub Statistic page on planet (http://planet.timvideos.us/stats/), I've added there 5 charts per project and worked on presenting data to the user, I still have to fix some small issues with charts but almost all is done with that part.

I've also created People page on planet (http://planet.timvideos.us/people/) with information about people related to TimVideos community, and almost all data is fetched from GitHub page (avatar, blog url, name, location, etc.), but you can also override that information if you want to customize it a little bit.

I've also made some small changes, like moving from prose.io application into gh-pages branch of my prose fork.

Now I will work at IRC notifications about updates and start working on page with issues, but I also need to learn to last exams in that semester. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.description: As per my last post, I was facing some problems with overlay component. With help of Sebastian Dröge (slomo) from #gstreamer, I was able to fix the data flow error but the following error still remains.

Tomorrow I will write a week summary post and small summary about my adventure with GSoC because of mid-term evaluation. :)

item.title: GSoC Update 6-23
item.description: This week

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 22/06/2014
item.description:
[research] research about javascript chart library (finally I've chosen Highchart)
[research/design] research about charts types and statistics available from GitHub (currently I am thinking about 3-4 charts: contributors activity (pie chart), commit timeline chart (area/line chart), code frequency chart (area/line chart), commits per weekday chart (pie chart)
[code] add first chart to planet.timvideos.us, pie chart with contributors activity in project, I've added 5 TimVideos projects to display that feature

Plans for next days:
[code] add another charts to planet
[code] add information on IRC if new posts has been added to planet (I am thinking about writing a listener on RSS feed from planet.timvideos.us and do action if something has changed, and I will set IRC notifications and social media notifications)
[management] move from Producteev to GitHub Issues and create new Issues with subtasks

This week I will have last exams, so I might not always be on IRC, but I will work hard to pass all exams and get all planned things done. :+1:
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: Porting Overlay Convertor
item.description: I started with porting the Overlay Convertor element which is used to add any text or logo over a video feed. This required a lot of work as I had to port Pango and PangoCairo to the new PyGI. I did the changes and tried to create a stream which resulted in these errors:

item.title: GSoC Update 6-20
item.description: snippets

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 20/06/2014 and 21/06/2014
item.description:
[code] changed design to serve better edit interface, now Prose.io conntected to current solution allows user to see realistic preview of written page.
[code] removed Prose from Getting Started Jekyll output and serve it as a separate project with gh-pages branch.
[code] add people page on planet.timvideos.us with People related to TimVideos community, in file people.html you only need to add a user to users list in metadata, and some information you want to override or add for user.

Users schema:

 users:  
  username:  
   name: name of user (Name Surname)  
   github: true or false (set true if you want to download information from github)  
   description: short description about the user  
   projects: list of projects where user contribute in TimVideos community  
   avatar_url: full url for avatar  
   profile_url: full url for profile (if something else than GitHub)  
   blog: full url for user's blog  
   location: user's location

Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: Week 4 Progress
item.description: I started with some missed changes and continued with porting of Theora encoder, Ogg muxer and httpstreamer consumer. With these components, I was able to “watch” a test video stream.

item.title: [GSoC] What hapenned during this week (week 4)
item.description:
During 4th week I was working on setting our websites to be monitored.

I've done some research, read a lot of articles about monitoring tools and I was so confused about all monitoring tools so I've chosen first from my list; and the choice was great. Monitis.com is very simple monitoring tool that has basic and advanced features, but suits our need in 100%, I've set monitoring for basic HTTP transaction (Monitis checks every one minute from 5-6 destinations if site is alive and if response has text to verify if page exists on requested address), full page load (to monitor time of website loading) and list of transactions (where Monitis plays previously recorded script).

I've added also many small and medium size features to planet.timvideos.us, like:
- social buttons on every post (for Twitter, Facebook and Google+), I am thinking about adding Pocket or other to save post to read it later;
- added excerpt for each post, it's fully configurable in _config.yml, so you can select how many words you want to display in excerpt;
- added Emoji support in post, so you can use Emoji's in your posts, like :1: :smile: :cinema:
- added small tooltip with information about time of reading selected post before you start reading,
- added generate tag, category pages, opml and rss feeds filtered by tags and categories, you can reach them with new RESTfull like routes: ie. planet.timvideo.us/categories/gsoc-2014/tags/news or planet.timvideos.us/tags/github or planet.timvideos.us/categories/gsoc-2014-hdmi2usb (if you want to download RSS or OPML just click on icons that are on the left of category/tag name in top right part of panel;
- fixed bug with wrongly attached layout for some posts,
- small css fixes;
- started working on People part of code.timvideos.us and pulling data from GitHub API

Next week I will work on code.timvideos.us and adding new features for that website and make it awesome!
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer
